study_scale: 15 sites in Slovenia and 153 tree chronologies
big_problems: I don't fully understand why they detrended the phenology data

study_scale: 15 sites in Slovenia and 153 tree chronologies
big_problems: I don't fully understand why they detrended the phenology data

study_scale: 10 elevational bands in 3 elevational transects on mountains in the eastern Swiss Alps
ifyouthink_no_why: they used snowmelt as a proxy for GSL but didn't actually measure or use the full GSL. I think it's more evidence for start of growing season and growth relationship
missing_something_major: they had vegetation phenolgy data but didn’t use it as a predictor, only as a response variable. Seems like they potentially have the data to look at stem density (their proxy fro biomass) ~ length of vegetative growing season
notes: 1. they used stem density as their measure of biomass; 2. they used elevation as a proxy for growing season temperature
